text: have you heard of histrionic personality
disorder what do you know about it like
many other mental illnesses and
disorders stigma misinformation and
false ideas that surround it can make it
hard for people to truly understand what
the disorder means so to help you get a
better idea of what this disorder is
this video will focus on histrionic
personality disorder what it is and the
signs to look out for what is it
histrionic personality disorder is the
def finded in the DSM 4 TR and dsm5 as a
personality disorder characterized by a
pattern of long-term rather than
episodic
self-dramatization in which someone
draws attention to themselves crave
activity and excitement overreact to
minor events experience angry outbursts
and are prone to manipulative suicide
threats and gestures because of this
they may sometimes appear to others as
shallow egocentric inconsiderate
dependent and helpless hisonic
personality disorder or HPD is part of a
larger group of psychological disorders
called cluster B personality disorders
disorders here are generally categorized
as being dramatic emotional or erratic
causes although it is unclear What
specifically causes histrionic
personality disorder it is most likely
the results of a combination of acquired
and inherited factors according to one
Theory hisonic personality disorder can
evolve as a result of childhood trauma
children may endure their trauma by
coping with their environment in ways
that might lead to the development of a
personality disorder another theory
talks about the influence of Parental
types where overindulgence or
inconsistent parenting can impact the
development of this disorder in children
furthermore parents who model dramatic
erratic unpredictable or inappropriate
sexual behavior May put their children
at a higher risk of developing this
personality disorder since histrionic
personality disorder appears to run in
families there is also some speculation
that it may have a genetic component a
family history of personality disorders
mental illness or substance use
disorders can be a factor as it is for
many other psychiatric disorders some
signs to look out for as per the dsm5
criteria diagnosis for histrionic
personal disorder requires meeting five
or more of the following criteria the
person is uncomfortable when not the
center of attention they have
interactions with others that is
characterized by inappropriate sexually
seductive or provocative Behavior
displays rapidly shifting and shallow
expression of emotions the person is
suggestible that is they are easily
influenced by others or circumstances
consistently uses their physical
attributes to draw attention attention
to themselves has a style of speech that
is excessively impressionistic and
lacking in detail shows
self-dramatization theatricality and
exaggerated expression of emotion
considers relationships to be more
intimate than they actually are
constantly seeking reassurance or
approval opinions are easily influenced
by other people but difficult to back up
with details in addition the symptoms
must cause significant impairment or
dist in an individual if you notice five
or more of the above mentioned signs we
advise you to visit a professional who
will be able to provide you the support
or guidance that you may need if you
find this video helpful be sure to like
subscribe and share this video with
those who might benefit from it and
don't forget to hit the notification
Bell icon to get notified whenever Psy
to go post a new video the references
and studies used in this video are added
in the description below thanks for
watching and see you in our next video
